content: Boy this was a great episode. I am amazed that this journalist created a company where all the employees were AI. Now that you can run competent AI on local hardware for 1/10th of what you would pay an intern for I imagine this will happen all the time. I found the emergent behavior of these agents to be particularly interesting. I hope he goes further and others pick up where he left off.

I wonder if this use case fits the "explore" approach Jacob mentions here
https://bsky.app/profile/adamhjk.me/post/3m2rdytzjz22o
I saw a youtube interview with the guy who created openclaw. He had some crazy stories of what openclaw did for him without even him prompting it to do so. That guy is a natural born explorer.
